sql:
CREATE TABLE salones (
  "id" INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT UNIQUE,
  "num_salon" INTEGER NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  "id_docente" INTEGER NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY ("id_docente") REFERENCES "docentes" ("id")
)

CREATE TABLE docentes (
   "id" INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT UNIQUE,
  "nombre" TEXT NOT NULL,
  "apellido" TEXT NOT NULL,
  "id_jornada" INTEGER NOT NULL,
  "id_usuario" INTEGER NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  FOREIGN KEY ("id_jornada") REFERENCES "jornada" ("id"),
  FOREIGN KEY ("id_usuario") REFERENCES "usuario" ("id")
)

CREATE TABLE jornada (
  "id" INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT UNIQUE,
  "descripcion" TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE
)

CREATE TABLE usuario (
  "id" INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT UNIQUE,
  "documento" INTEGER NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  "clave" INTEGER NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  "codigo" INTEGER NOT NULL UNIQUE
)

CREATE TABLE tipos (
  "id" INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT UNIQUE,
  "tipo" TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE
)

CREATE TABLE estados (
  "id" INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT UNIQUE,
  "estado" TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE
)

CREATE TABLE inventario (
  "id" INTEGER NOT NULL primary key AUTOINCREMENT UNIQUE,
  "nombre_art" TEXT NOT NULL,
  "cantidad_art" TEXT NOT NULL,
  "id_salon" INTEGER NOT NULL,
  "id_tipo" TEXT NOT NULL,
  "id_estado" TEXT NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY ("id_salon") REFERENCES "salones" ("id"),
  FOREIGN KEY ("id_tipo") REFERENCES "tipos" ("id"),
  FOREIGN KEY ("id_estado") REFERENCES "estados" ("id")
)
